respStmt.resp: Taught the editor TEI, advised on document
respStmt.name: Dr. Aaron Mauro

respStmt.resp: Advised on changes to TEI structure, helped bring project to internet space
respStmt.name: Dr. Elisa Beshero-Bondar

publicationStmt.p: Produced as final project in DIGIT 110 class at Penn State Behrend.

notesStmt.note: Document originally created for DIGIT 110 class, updated for online publishing in spring 2021.

sourceDesc.p: This group of texts includes dinner programs for a event called Harambee, hosted every fall semester at Penn State Behrend by the MCC. These programs traditionally are left on the dinner tables at the event for patrons to look through, but are ultimately to throw away. The event has been going on for 32 years in 2018, but only 8 programs have been salvaged.
Dinner Programs are held at Penn State Behrend Library Archives.

org.desc: MCC is the initialism for the Multi-Cultural Council, a student-led governing body of Penn State Behrend that is responsible for hosting the Harambee Dinners.
SGA is the initialism for the Student Government Association, a student-led governing body of Penn State Behrend.
NSBE is the acronym for National Society of Black Engineers, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
ABC is the initialism for Association of Black Collegians, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
HRPC is the initialism for Human Relations Programming Council, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
ISO is the initialism for International Student Organization, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
OACS is the initialism for Organization of Caribbean and African Students, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
ASO is the initialism for Asian Student Organization, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
MSA is the initialism for Muslim Student Organization, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
OLAS is the acronym for Organization of Latin American Students, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
Trigon is the former name of a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC. Currently the club is called Gender and Sexuality Equality with the acronym of GASE.
SASO is the acronym for South Asian Student Organization, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
WT is the initialism for Women Today, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
CCC is the initialism for Cultural Cooking Club, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
AAUW is the initialism for American Association of University Women, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.
CCAC is the initialism for Chinese Cultural Advancement Club, a club of Penn State Behrend and an organization under the MCC.

encodingDesc.ab: Menus and Thank You sections have been made into lists. All typos have been silently corrected. Only clubs have been given xmlids.

list.item: Marble Cake with Butter Cream Icing
Everybody that had any part in making this event happen

div.p: Harambee is Swahili for "Let us all pull together" and originated in the country of Kenya as a slogan for national unity. We use this celebration as a way to unite our campus community and celebrate the cultures and richness of diversity that is represented among our students, faculty, and staff.

div.head: UNITY
div.quote: Majestic moon and splendid sun, all a part of everyone.

div.p: Harambee is Swahili for “Let us all pull together” and originated in the country of Kenya as a slogan for national unity. Today we use this slogan as a way to unite our campus community as we celebrate HARAMBEE'S 25TH ANNIVERSARY of cultural enrichment and diversity that is represented among our students, faculty, and staff.

div.head: UNITY
div.quote: Majestic moon and splendid sun, all a part of everyone.

Harambee is Swahili for “Let us all pull together”, it originated in the country of Kenya as a slogan for national unity. We use this celebration as a way to unite our campus community and to celebrate the culture and richness of diversity represented among our students, faculty and staff.

div.head: UNITY
div.quote: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.

div.p: Celebrating 27 years of unity at PSU Behrend!

div.p: October 04, 2018 Celebrating 32 Years of Unity at Behrend

Harambee is Swahili for "Let us all pull together”. It originated in the country of Kenya as a slogan for national unity. Today we use this slogan as a way to unite our campus community and to celebrate the richness of cultures and diversity represented among our students, faculty, and staff.
